text: ST T T E e e e g e e e o meme e memm e 5. (a) Sara and Tara agree to meet for lunch. Sara arrives at a time S distributed uniformly over the hour between 12:00 and 13:00. Tara arrives independently at a time 7" with the same uniform distribution. We consider 12:00 as time zero and measure time in minutes. (b) (2 marks) What is the joint probability density of S,T? (c) (2 marks) Write an inequality expressing the event that Sara must wait more than 10 minutes for Tara? (d) (6 marks) What is the probability that Sara must wait more than 10 minutes for Tara?
